statement:
If $\sum a_{n}$ is a series of positive real terms and
$$\sqrt[n]{a_{n}} < k < 1$$ for all $n > N$, then $\sum a_{n}$ is
convergent. If $\sqrt[n]{a_{n}} \geq 1$ for an infinite number of values
of $n$, then $\sum a_{n}$ is divergent.

### Limit form {#limit-form .unnumbered}

Given a series $\sum a_{n}$ of complex terms, set
$$\rho = \limsup_{n \to \infty} \sqrt[n]{| a_{n} |}$$ The series
$\sum a_{n}$ is absolutely convergent if $\rho < 1$ and is divergent if
$\rho > 1$. If $\rho = 1$, then the test is inconclusive.
